description: From Middle English forspenden, from Old English forspendan (“to spend up, give out, squander, consume”), equivalent to for- +‎ spend.

verbs.description: forspend (third-person singular simple present forspends, present participle forspending, simple past and past participle forspent)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To spend up; spend completely; exhaust, as by overexertion.
examples: A painful march, / Through twenty hours of night and day prolong'd, / Forespent the British troops.
